title: Shiny rmarkdown article
code: renderPlot({   hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE,        breaks = as.numeric(input$n_breaks),        xlab = "Duration (minutes)",        main = "Geyser eruption duration")    dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust)   lines(dens, col = "blue") })

title: Shiny RMD Vignette
code: renderPlot({   hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE,        breaks = as.numeric(input$n_breaks),        xlab = "Duration (minutes)",        main = "Geyser eruption duration")    dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust)   lines(dens, col = "blue") })

what: get data from a private page
title: test-quarto-article
text: https://osf.io/deq3w private page containing copy iris: get data Serocalculator:
code: library(osfr) Automatically registered OSF personal access token library(dplyr) Attaching package: 'dplyr' The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':      filter, lag The following objects are masked from 'package:base':      intersect, setdiff, setequal, union #  iris2 <- osf_retrieve_file("deq3w") |>    osfr::osf_download(path = tempdir(), conflicts = "overwrite") |>    pull("local_path") |>    read.csv()  iris2 |> head() X Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species 1 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa 2 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa 3 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa 4 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa 5 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa 6 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa library(dplyr) temp <- osf_retrieve_file("n6cp3") |>    osfr::osf_download(path = tempdir(), conflicts = "overwrite") |>    pull("local_path") |>    readr::read_rds()  temp # A tibble: 3,336 × 8    index_id Country    cluster  catchment   Age ageCat antigen_iso result    <chr>    <chr>      <fct>    <chr>     <dbl> <fct>  <fct>        <dbl>  1 B1       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka       4   <5     HlyE_IgA     7.24  2 B2       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka       4   <5     HlyE_IgG    24.0  3 B3       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka       3.7 <5     HlyE_IgA     0.836  4 B4       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka       3.7 <5     HlyE_IgG     3.17  5 B5       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka      10.6 5-15   HlyE_IgA     3.42  6 B6       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka      10.6 5-15   HlyE_IgG    14.3  7 B7       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka      16   16+    HlyE_IgA     8.84  8 B8       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka      16   16+    HlyE_IgG    14.2  9 B9       Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka      16.5 16+    HlyE_IgA    10.3 10 B10      Bangladesh Ward 2 N dhaka      16.5 16+    HlyE_IgG    29.4 # ℹ 3,326 more rows

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: can install development version test.package GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN. see vignette("test123", package = "test.package") information. see ?hello info function.
code: library(test.package) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
title: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
text: Counts test results grouping variable (Created Date, default) adds useful columns

title: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
text: data data.frame() tibble(). string matching one column names data; default  "Created Date".

title: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
text: object type data, following columns added: n tests n results n positive % positive period output arranged ascending order variable identified argument; , arranged chronological order Created Date, default.
